identified-content.person: GRUEN, ALEXIS CAROLINE AHLFORS (ALEXIS CAROLINE AHLFORS CUTCHINS)

block.p: Alexis Caroline Ahlfors Gruen, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael S. Gruen of New York, was married yesterday to William Witherspoon Cutchins Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. Cutchins of Richmond. The Rev. John T. Tarrant performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Stockbridge, Mass.

Mrs. Cutchins, 24, and Mr. Cutchins, 23, graduated from Hamilton College. She is a research technician on hormonal regulation of obesity at Emory University in Atlanta, where he is a doctoral candidate in organic chemistry.

Alexis Caroline Ahlfors Gruen, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael S. Gruen of New York, was married yesterday to William Witherspoon Cutchins Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. Cutchins of Richmond. The Rev. John T. Tarrant performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Stockbridge, Mass.

Mrs. Cutchins, 24, and Mr. Cutchins, 23, graduated from Hamilton College. She is a research technician on hormonal regulation of obesity at Emory University in Atlanta, where he is a doctoral candidate in organic chemistry.

The bride's father is a partner in Gruen & Farrelly, a New York law firm. He was a founder of the New York Landmarks Conservancy and is a member of the legal committee of the Municipal Art Society in New York, for which the bride's mother, Vanessa Gruen, is the director of special projects. Mrs. Gruen is also the vice president of the board of Learning Through an Expanded Arts Program, which provides instruction in New York public schools.

The bridegroom's mother, Caroline M. Cutchins, is a clinical exercise specialist at the Y.M.C.A. of Greater Richmond. His father is the executive vice president of CCA Financial, a technology equipment leasing business in Richmond.
